page.title: 06EDUCATING SESSAY
page.content: {Education}in the 1980s can never have been more interesting for pupils and teachers. In many ways children do not change - mostly eager to learn, still mischievous, still very lovable. Recently they have appeared more con- fident, finding it easy to converse on a wide variety of topics. Widening experiences including{television and {computers}have helped, but some children have, by the same token, lost out on{family games and conversation. The close connection between school and a caring community, continues to produce useful citizens. But the task becomes more difficult as standards in the country continue to fall. Daily we hear of children involved in violence, drug-taking and corrupt activities. My hope for the future is that the good quality of teachers and parents in Sessay will repel such invading evils.
